titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2185) to extend the Temporary Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 2002.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 108-123, by Mr. Diaz-Balart, L..

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 2185 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Bill is closed to amendments.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 47.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 248.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 217 - 203 (Roll no. 213).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 216 - 201 (Roll no. 214).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 5/22/2003--Passed House without amendment. (This measure has not been amended since it was introduced in the House on May 21, 2003. The summary of that version is repeated here.)Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H.R. 2185 (extending the Temporary Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 2002).
